title: Build branded Homepage for D’ZETA using provided SSS-tier copy + vintage-modern earth-tone styling

requirements.text: Create a new dedicated Homepage at route '/' that implements the provided homepage copywriting as five sections in this order: (1) Hero section with headline, sub-headline, and two CTA buttons, (2) “The Digital Edge” value proposition grid with three feature blurbs, (3) “The Social & Eco Impact” section with body text and a live counter area, (4) “Explore Our Space (370 m²)” section listing the four zones with short descriptions, (5) a professional footer block matching the provided footer copy.

quotes: ini draf Copywriting Homepage SSS-Tier ... Section 1 ... Section 5 ...

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to '/' renders a homepage (not the Mini Museum page).
All five sections are present and appear in the order provided by the user.
Hero section includes 2 CTA buttons labeled exactly as provided in the draft.
Explore Our Space section lists: Quiet Room, Rooftop Sanctuary, Mini Garden, Heritage Museum, each with its provided description.

requirements.text: Wire the homepage CTAs to existing routes: the primary CTA should navigate to the Menu/ordering experience, and the secondary CTA should navigate to an exploration experience (Mini Museum and/or booking) using the existing TanStack Router routes.

quotes: CTA Buttons:[Pesan Sekarang & Pantau Antrean] [Jelajahi Sudut D'ZETA]

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the primary CTA takes the user to an existing route for ordering/menu (e.g., '/menu').
Clicking the secondary CTA takes the user to an existing route for exploring the space/storytelling (e.g., '/museum' or '/booking').
Routing uses TanStack Router navigation (no full page refresh).

requirements.text: Apply the requested “Vintage Modern” look to the homepage (and only homepage if global theme changes are risky), using earth-tone styling aligned to the provided palette guidance: Deep Forest Green, Terracotta, and White Smoke; and use a serif headline + sans-serif body pairing consistent with the current Tailwind font configuration.

quotes: CEO Pro-Tip: Pastikan UI (tampilan) web lo punya sentuhan Vintage Modern. Pake warna-warna bumi (earth tone) ...
Warna: Gunakan perpaduan Deep Forest Green ... Terracotta ... White Smoke ...
Font: Pakai kombinasi Serif ... dan Sans Serif ...

acceptanceCriteria: Homepage headings visibly use the serif font family and body text uses the sans font family.
Homepage primary accents reflect earth-tone styling (green/terracotta) and remain readable in light mode.
No immutable frontend hook files are modified.

requirements.text: Update routing and navigation behaviors to reflect that '/' is now the Homepage: change the index route component to the new Homepage, update BottomNav active-state logic so it no longer treats '/' as the Museum route, and update any “Back to Home” navigation that currently points to '/museum' to instead point to '/'.

quotes: oh dan ini bikin homepage nya dulu

acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/App.tsx, the '/' route renders the new Homepage component.
BottomNav does not highlight “Museum” when the user is on '/'.
The Museum page remains accessible at '/museum' and behaves as before.

requirements.text: Implement the Homepage “Live Counter” area using existing available metrics queries/components where possible, with graceful fallbacks if metrics are unavailable (e.g., show placeholders or ‘—’ rather than breaking layout). Counters must include the three items from the draft: ‘520+ Kilogram Limbah Terolah’, ‘5 Kecamatan Mitra Lokal’, and ‘100% Listrik Terjamin (Backup System)’.

quotes: Live Counter (Simulasi Angka):520+ Kilogram Limbah Terolah5 Kecamatan Mitra Lokal100% Listrik Terjamin (Backup System)

acceptanceCriteria: Homepage shows a 3-item counter block with the exact labels from the draft.
If backend metrics queries fail or return empty, the homepage still renders without runtime errors and shows a sensible fallback state for the counters.
If metrics are available, the UI may display real values but must preserve the three draft counter categories/labels.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only shadcn components).
Do not edit immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx).
Keep backend as a single Motoko actor; no additional backend services.
nonGoals: Implementing the 5 additional “Gong” features (reviews, zonal ordering/table mapping, per-order impact popup, menu-item ‘Story’ modal, and any new booking logic) beyond what is needed to build and route the homepage.
Adding new authentication providers beyond Internet Identity.

preferencesToAdd: Use English for any user-facing text in the build request.
